intro: Harpullia crustacea, commonly known as the rough-fruited harpullia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its compound leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, rough-textured fruits. Harpullia crustacea is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
